candidates.name: Sandra Coney
candidates.why_elect: I have had experience in the regional council, council and local board so I know how local government works and how to get things to happen. I have lived all my life in the West and I have strong connections with the community.
candidates.why_stand: I am committed to protecting the things that are precious about Waitakere, our green areas and our heritage, natural and historic. We have legislation that says our area is of national significance so we have to protect it for future generations.

candidates.name: Tony Hartnett
candidates.why_elect: I have career experience in environmental and energy planning in NZ and Canada. I understand the workings and politics of local and central government. I continue to work with people at community level. I am able to work with people on committees to translate policy ideas into budgets and actions.
candidates.why_stand: I have lived here for thirty years and love the Waitakere Ranges. I have served on the New Lynn Community Board. I helped Auckland Council to declare a climate emergency. I want to make progress on a local and Auckland Climate Action plan, before it is too late.

candidates.name: Greg Presland
candidates.why_elect: As well as my political experience I have practised law out west for 30 years and have helped people through stressful times. I have also been heavily involved with local community organisations and I know how wonderful and constructive local groups can be.
candidates.why_stand: I am the current chair and have served three terms. The job is challenging and exhilarating. I have lived here for 30 years and my kids were born here. The area and the people are magnificent. But there are many challenges and I want to make the west even better.

candidates.name: Mark Roberts
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Titirangi for 36 years, love the Waitakere Ranges and our local communities. A Chartered Accountant and Commercial Pilot I have worked most of the last 25 years as Company Director and Chief Executive. I will bring governance, management, financial skills and passion to the role.
candidates.why_stand: I am appreciative of the opportunities and lifestyle afforded my family by the wonderful Waitakere Ranges area. I see issues within the area that need to be addressed and want to make a contribution. I now have the time, energy and skill set to do this.

candidates.name: Michelle Wineera
candidates.why_elect: I love the community I live in and have loads of experience in management, people skills and a natural tendency to care for the environment.
candidates.why_stand: I am fortunate to live in the most naturally beautiful environment in Auckland. The Waitakere community are warm and friendly, innovative and creative and we really do care about our native bush which we all need to protect for our future generations to come.

candidates.before_politics: Manager comm dev and env group
candidates.name: Mark Allen
candidates.why_elect: I have worked in and with local government for 30 years in a variety of roles. So I know how the beast works and doesn't. So I know the tricks, I know what needs to done, when to get things happening and I am independent.
candidates.why_stand: I love our area. Raised in Laingholm, built our house at Te Henga and raised three great boys in our fabulous local schools. I believe we need to get the local back into local government in Auckland. More decision making at the local board and in the local community.
